data.title: [D2k] Added the 'Damage' UncloakType to several units
data.body: Changed: Saboteur, Fremen and Stealth Raider. Closes #12192.

data.title: Implement wave 'distortion' effect for TS an d2k sonic zaps
data.body: Sonic zaps in D2k and TS had some 'wavey' distortion effect. In D2k it was pure distortion of the ground without additional color, in TS it was combined with what looked like Additive blending (instead of the mere transparency we use currently).

data.title: Added SpawnDelay for SpawnActorOnDeath trait
data.body:
> This new property will delay actor spawn on death (useful when you need to play unit's death animation first without overlapping dead actor and new actor).

Supersedes #11752.

Basically the important part of #11752 + some style fixes by me.

data.title: Third round of interface moving, making explicit and cleanup
data.body:
Moves `IRenderInfantrySequenceModifier`, all combat Modifier interfaces and the `IPowerModifier` interface to mod code and makes them require explicit implementation.

This probably concludes the moving of interfaces for now.
Further follow-ups will likely just make interface implementations explicit in more places.

data.title: Selecting issues
data.body:
With the newest release, i have unit selection issues, sometimes, it doesn’t work in the way that nothing gets selected.
I am using kubuntu 16.04

data.title: Remove Bloody Delta from the ra map pool
data.body:
Closes #12282.

I tend to agree with #12282 because we have a lot of other good 1v1 maps in the pool thanks to the RA GL maps. Although `Bloody Delta` has some nice visuals, I also don't really like the bottle neck (only one mud bridge) and the slightly imbalanced spawns (east is nearer to the shore).

Also see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OgYJpaPtlNI.

data.title: More explicit interface cleanups
data.body:
Follow-up to #12268.

This one might need at least a bit of testing for potential regressions on sprite bodies, sprite turrets and armaments, though in my own testing I didn't encounter any issues.

To make up for it, the diff is a lot smaller this time.
- moves `INotifyDamageStateChanged` to mod code
- makes explicit interface implementation mandatory for the above and `INotifyBuildComplete`
- adresses a few more cases that previously made implicit interfaces overridable, preventing explicit implementations
- some more misc 'collateral' explicit implementations

data.title: OpenRA.Utility --resize-map fills expanded areas with same base ground tile
data.body: ...Whereas a newly generated map is filled uniformly with randomized base ground tiles. `OpenRA.Utility --resize-map` should replicate this behavior; Painting over the new map areas manually with the 1-tile terrain tool is tedious, even with the help of copy-and-paste.

data.title: Suggestion: Remove Map "Blody Delta" from official maps (RA)
data.body: I talked to some pro players and they all confirmed that this map doesn't satisfies the standard map quality anymore.

data.title: Translate the Battlefield News into the player's OS language
data.body:
Following https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7006 's idea, I think that official messages displayed in the _Battlefields News dropdown menu_ should be translated into the player's OS language. This would make the message have more impact on the player and catch his/her attention. 

Note that not all news should be translated, but only the ones for Releases (and perhaps Playtests too?). Indeed, it would be hard to ask for translations for every message posted in this _Battlefield News dropdown menu_.

Here is an example of text that woud need to be translated:

> We are happy to announce a new stable release of OpenRA. Head over to our website at http://openra.net to see the full announcement, and take a look at the full changelog at http://changelog.openra.net to get an impression of all the changes. We wish you a lot of fun with this new release!

Todo: 
- [ ] make OpenRA detect the player's OS language (if not already)
- [ ] ask volunteers for translations (with time, I am sure contributors from foreign countries will send us their translations)
- [ ] Display first the translated message, then, below it, the original message in English.

![battlefieldnews_translation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/19619279/b09d8eb2-9863-11e6-85f7-d4bf784ab490.gif)

data.title: Rebinding Fn keys no longer works in TD
data.body: I rebind my Fn keys to production tabs for placing buildings, i.e. F1 for Norman building structs, F2 for defence structs, this no longer works in TD, F1 builds the item on slot 0 of the active menu etc. I am drunk and just remembered this, sorry if this issue makes no sense

data.title: Alarm-system against spies
data.body:
we could give defense-structure a small (1-2 cell) range to let detect "unknown units" and play a alarm (bleep5.aud) + flash the tower itself as long as an enemy spy is moving in his radius ... by flashing i mean , let him blink like a building that gets captured

by detecting i dont mean that the spies lose their disguise , just that they got noticed and the player is alarmed

this way , we could encourage people to build walls around bases or structures with entrances ... and this adds a more realistic detecting methode for allies ... along with the dogs for soviet 

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19815

data.title: Fix the search for alternative transports not caring about passenger types
data.body: Fixes #12273.

data.title: Fully support unhardcoded sequences in the voxel render traits
data.body:
Seems like someone missed unhardcoding the strings in `RenderPreviewVoxels`.
Also unhardcoded the sequence of `WithVoxelWalkerBody`.

data.title: Any tank type can be loaded into ANY transportation unit by using a trick
data.body: I found out that you can load ANY tank type into choppers, Phase tanks, APC's, rangers, just by using a simple trick. Normally you should only be able to do this in a naval transport, But i found out that by selecting an over-amount of units that the transports u have at the shoreline which the naval transports can hol, using the Alt-shift combination on 2 naval transports(so thats 10 tanks of any kind, And besides that you can remove the second naval transport before units reach them to load themselves in), In combination with ANY other transport unit like a chopper, phase transport, apc, or a ranger, setup close to the same shoreline will make the tankgroup which is left after the naval transport is fully loaded, load into the other transport units that are placed close to the same shoreline. I tested this over and over in single player and multiplayer. And it works. You can basicly make a chinook drop with 16 artilleries behind the enemy base without any trouble. which is much faster and than a chronoshift, and lasts indefinately. and the amount can be stacked as high as you want to. I really think this is a bug that needs to be fixed. Waiting for a response, And before that, CHEERS!!! :D Ohmk Torque (ingame player name)

data.title: RA - Make Radar Dome lose Stealth Detection ability if Powered Down/on Low Power
data.body:
Was watching FiveAces' video and as a comment at here says, i agree that it doesn't make any sense that Stealth Detection ability of Radar still work if it is Powered Down. Also doing this would make players another reason to not Power Down the Radar.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oPJvGgy-ZHs&t=1529s

Also maybe same should go for Defences.

data.title: Several internal interface cleanups
data.body:
This PR 
- moves the check for explicit interface implementation violation to the start of `make check` so you don't have to wait for other style checks to finish
- moves several trait interfaces with no remaining ties to `Game` to `Mods.Common`
- makes two of the moved interfaces require explicit implementation
- explicitly implements interfaces where possible for the traits I had to touch
- moves warhead `ImpactTypes` to `Warhead`
- performs some additional minor style cleanups

All in all, the numbers of changed files and changed lines look far worse than they really are, because pretty much all of the changes are about moving stuff around or making interfaces explicit and would get caught at compile or `make check` if I messed up somewhere.

data.title: Reduce aircraft ground reveal
data.body:
Uses the upgradability to reduce aircraft sight range to 3 cells when landed in RA and TD.

Closes #2535.

data.title: timer of fast-forwarded replay doesnt match played timer
data.body:
in the replay-menu ... you can check the "played" time in the preview section (under the map-name) ... 
i noticed that when i fast-forward , the timer doesnt match the actually played time , and the replay ends faster ... 
so for example  , i had a game that took me 10:06 minutes to play ... but when i watch the replay and fastforward all of it ... the replay ends at 9:34

data.title: Unknown Error When Launching Server /w Port Forwarding On
data.body:
I'm having this weird error when trying to get a server up and running
## Port Forwarding Off

```
####@dpServer19:~/Gameserver/_openra/_ra_casual$ ./run
[2016-10-19T10:36:09] Starting dedicated server for mod: ra
[2016-10-19T10:36:14] Master server communication established.
[2016-10-19T10:36:14] Warning: Server ports are not forwarded.
[2016-10-19T10:36:14] Game has not been advertised online.
[2016-10-19T10:36:50] User has joined the game.
[2016-10-19T10:37:06] User changed the map to ExampleMap1.
[2016-10-19T10:37:06] Singleplayer games have been disabled on this server.
[2016-10-19T10:37:19] User changed the map to ExampleMap2.
[2016-10-19T10:37:19] Singleplayer games have been disabled on this server.
[2016-10-19T10:37:24] User has disconnected.
^C
```
## Port Forwarding On

```
####@dpServer19:~/Gameserver/_openra/_ra_casual$ ./run
[2016-10-19T10:38:35] Starting dedicated server for mod: ra

Unhandled Exception:
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) <0x41e45970 + 0x000ac> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) <0x41e1dae0 + 0x00503> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x41d94830 + 0x00283> in <filename unknown>:0 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) <0x41e45970 + 0x000ac> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) <0x41e1dae0 + 0x00503> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x41d94830 + 0x00283> in <filename unknown>:0 
^C

```

Port forwarding has been configured and is working however I am still getting this error.
Server was running on Ubuntu 16.04.

On an unrelated note, is there any setting to set the default map?
